tutorialDialogue.text: Welcome, Cadet, to the 911 operator training program. As a fresh recruit of the Operator Academy, you need to get to grips with the basics of how to deal with calls and dispatch units. If you can do that, then maybe you stand a chance at saving some lives.

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay!

tutorialDialogue.text: On your screen now is your dispatch workspace system. Any time a caller or I communicate with you, it’ll show up in this highlighted box, your communications terminal. The terminal will also display the caller ID, and a photo if one is available

acceptedAnswers.text: Got it, Sir!

tutorialDialogue.text: Below the terminal, your options for responses will appear. The dispatch system will automatically display one or more possible speech actions. Each action will have its own consequences, so you’ll have to think carefully about what you say - it could be the difference between life and death.

acceptedAnswers.text: Yes Sir!

tutorialDialogue.text: Let’s try it out. You’ve got three choices now. I want you to pick a colour.

acceptedAnswers.text: Red
Blue
Purple

tutorialDialogue.text: , eh? Well, if you’ve got the hang of that, let’s move on. I’m going to trigger a call in a minute, and we’ll see how you handle a live-action simulation. When a call alert appears, just click the answer button and you’ll be patched through to the caller. Ready to begin?

acceptedAnswers.text: I'm ready!

tutorialDialogue.text: Incoming Call Alert
Hello? Hi. My cat’s stuck in a tree and I can’t get him to come down. He’s been up there for hours. Can you help me?

acceptedAnswers.text: Uhhh…
Okay, stay calm. I’m going to need details. How tall is the tree?
This is a bit cliche, isn’t it?

tutorialDialogue.text: Right, don’t panic. Always try to start by getting important information. Ask questions so that you can learn more about the problem.

acceptedAnswers.text: Understood, Sir!

tutorialDialogue.text: That’s a good start! Did you notice that when you answered the call, the timer in the top right of your workspace triggered? Every call will have a time limit, so you’ve got to act quickly.

acceptedAnswers.text: Right, okay. So what happens next?

tutorialDialogue.text: Yeah, yeah, I know. We try to start you off on something easy, instead of throwing you straight in at the deep end. But anyway, how do you think you should proceed with this call?

acceptedAnswers.text: I should probably ask some questions, help this poor cat out.

tutorialDialogue.text: Good! Maybe you aren't so hopeless after all. Did you notice the timer in the top right of your workspace trigger when you answered the call? Every call will have a time limit so you need to be quick. For this training session, however, you've been given plenty of time, so you don't need worry. It won't be so generous when it's for real!

acceptedAnswers.text: Easy! What's next?
A time limit? Great, just what I need…

tutorialDialogue.text: You need to pay attention here. On the bottom of your screen is your main tool of the trade - the dispatch button. It's disabled at the moment, you need some training first!

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay, so what do I do?

tutorialDialogue.text: If you don't act fast, situations can get worse very quickly, and end very badly. If that happens, the blame falls to you. You've got a lot of responsibility!

acceptedAnswers.text: I'll do my best Chief. What's next?

tutorialDialogue.text: At any time during a call, you can press the dispatch button on the bottom of your work station, which opens your Dispatch-O-matic program. There, you can select which services to dispatch to aid a caller.

acceptedAnswers.text: That sounds easy enough, let's do it!

tutorialDialogue.text: Don't be too hasty - once you've confirmed the units you want to dispatch, the call will end and there's no going back, so you've got to be sure. There's also a compromise here between efficiency and performance.

acceptedAnswers.text: Go on...

tutorialDialogue.text: Sometimes you might think you know what to dispatch, but it's worth taking time to ask more questions before you take action. There could be more problems that you need to learn about first.

acceptedAnswers.text: That sounds alright. What's the catch?

tutorialDialogue.text: Your performance is judged on how quickly you deal with a call, and what you dispatch. Dispatch the wrong units and you'll face a score penalty, but taking too long will impact your score too.

acceptedAnswers.text: Oh great, as if my job wasn't hard enough already
So be smart and quick? I can do that!

tutorialDialogue.text: Don't panic, I'm sure you'll be fine! Oh, another thing: some dialogue options add or remove points from your score, so think about what you say. Giving a caller bad advice will hurt your performance.

acceptedAnswers.text: Even more pressure. Fantastic. Anything else you want to throw at me?
I can handle that. What's next?

tutorialDialogue.text: Good! You should also be aware that some dialogue options add or remove points from your score, so think about what you say. Giving a caller bad advice will hurt your performance.

acceptedAnswers.text: Alright. Anything else?

tutorialDialogue.text: Well, since you asked… Each call will have a 'critical' service - one service that must be dispatched in order to solve the problem. If you fail to figure out what that service is, you'll fail the call.

acceptedAnswers.text: Great. That's got to be everything, right?

tutorialDialogue.text: That's the spirit! Be aware, each call will have a 'critical' service - one service that must be dispatched in order to solve the problem. If you fail to figure out what that service is, you'll fail the call.

acceptedAnswers.text: Great. That's got to be everything, right?

tutorialDialogue.text: Nearly! Once you've dispatched your services, you'll see a news update that shows you the consequences of your actions. You'll also receive a personal review from me, where I'll award you a ranking. I'm expecting good things from you.

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay, understood. I think I'm ready to start!

tutorialDialogue.text: Excellent, Cadet! One final point - you can choose to trigger a dispatch at any point in the call, but, if you leave it too late, the caller will have to prompt you, so try to take control of the situation and act fast.

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay, I'll keep that in mind!

tutorialDialogue.text: If you're ready, I'll fire up the simulator again. Normally you'd have access to your dispatch software as soon as the call starts, but I want you to take your time with this, so I'll activate it once I think you need it. Ready?

acceptedAnswers.text: Alright, let's get this over with.
I'm ready, let's do it!

tutorialDialogue.text: Hello? Hi. My cat’s stuck in a tree and I can’t get him to come down. He’s been up there for hours. Can you help me?

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay, is it a tall tree? Is the cat hurt at all?
What's it doing in the tree? Is it moving?
You should definitely consider a dog, they'd never pull this stunt.

tutorialDialogue.text: It's quite a tall tree, it's the same height as my home. I don't think he's hurt, but he won't move. I think he can't find a way down.

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay, is the tree easily accessible from the road?

tutorialDialogue.text: I think he was chasing a bird, you know what cats are like. He's sitting on a branch near the top, I don't think he can get down.

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay, is the tree easily accessiblefrom the road?

tutorialDialogue.text: Cadet, try to stay on-topic please. Help the cat!

acceptedAnswers.text: Aye aye, Captain.

tutorialDialogue.text: Oh yes, I should've mentioned that. The tree is outside the front of our home. It's just by the road.

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay, and what's your address please?

tutorialDialogue.text: What should I do? It's almost time for his dinner and he won't come down!

acceptedAnswers.text: What was it doing in the tree? Is it moving now?

tutorialDialogue.text: We live at 32 Hillside Rd. We've got a big blue van parked on the drive, you can't miss it!

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay, that should be all the information I need!

tutorialDialogue.text: Right, I think you're ready to dispatch now. Just open the menu, switch on the services you want and click dispatch. The rest will happen automatically. If you ever need to remind yourself of how to play, or you want to improve a score, you can replay levels as many times as you like. Right, I think that's everything, get to it!

dialogue2.text:
<incoming news update> 
<Message begin:> 
Police report an increase in jewlery and bank robberies. $800,000 already stolen from stores this month. Police advice caution to those holding large sums of money. 
<Message end>

acceptedAnswers.text: <Dismiss Update>

dialogue2.text: Occasionally, you'll receive updates like this from emergency services. It's our hope that increased communication between our teams will help us respond quicker. If you hear anything about robberies, keep in mind the possibility of dangerou weapons and hurt citizens.

acceptedAnswers.text: Understood, Sir!

dialogue2.text: Incoming Call Alert
Hello, I need help please. There's been a break-in at the store I'm in.

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay, stay calm. I need to know what store you're in
Right, are the perpetrators still there? What's happening now?

dialogue2.text: I'm in, uh, it's called C - L Jewelers, it's just a small shop, on the high-street. The alarm's still going off so I had to go outside to call. It's on…uhh…Clifton Road? Yeah, that's it.

acceptedAnswers.text: Alright, what happened to the perpetrators? How many were there? Do they have a car?

dialogue2.text: They're gone now. They had guns though. I think they took a lot of stuff.

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay, can you tell me where you are? Where's the store?

dialogue2.text: There was two of them, they drove off. I didn't see the car though. I can't believe this has happened, it was so scary. I thought I was gonna die for sure. I'm so scared right now.

acceptedAnswers.text: I need you to snap out of this, or else I can't help you.
It's alright, I'm going to help you. Can you tell me your name?

dialogue2.text: Wow okay, thanks for the support. Are you going to send help or not?

acceptedAnswers.text: What's your name? Can you tell me what happened? Is anyone hurt?

dialogue2.text: My name's Matt.

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay Matt, how old are you? Are you on your own right now?
Good to meet you Matt. Can you tell me if anyone's hurt

dialogue2.text: I'm Matt. They had a gun. I think they shot the owner. It all happened so fast. There was a couple of other people. I think they ran. Someone hit my head, it was all such a blur.

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay Matt. I need you to go back inside the building and find the owner

dialogue2.text: I'm 24. I think the store owner is still inside. I think he got hurt. Someone hit my head too. It all feels like a blur.

acceptedAnswers.text: Alright Matt, are you able to find the owner?

dialogue2.text:
Okay. Hold on. I'll see if I can find him. 
… … … ...okay, I found him!

acceptedAnswers.text: Good. Is he breathing? I need you tell me if he's hurt
Can you see any injuries on him? Is he conscious?

dialogue2.text:
Uhh, I think so. I'll go inside. I can't believe this has happened. 
… … … ...okay, I found him!

acceptedAnswers.text: Can you see any injuries on him? Is he conscious?
That's great Matt. I need you check if he's breathing. Any injuries?

dialogue2.text: I think he's breathing, yeah. He isn't awake though. I can see some blood on his shoulder. Left Shoulder. I think that's where he got shot.

acceptedAnswers.text: Alright, well done. Is there a lot of blood? Can you see where it's coming from?
I'm going to need you put him into the recovery position. I'll talk you through it, don't worry

dialogue2.text: I'm going to need you put him into the recovery position. I'll talk you through it, don't worry.

acceptedAnswers.text: Alright, thank you. Is the wound bleeding a lot? We might need to dress it.
If he's been out cold a while, I'm going to need you to put him in the recovery position

dialogue2.text: There's a big red patch on his shirt, but I can't see much coming out of him now. Oh man, it looks like something from a film. What should I do?

acceptedAnswers.text: If the wound looks okay, I'm going to need you put him into the recovery position

dialogue2.text: Oh my god, okay. Man this is scary. Okay, what should I do?

acceptedAnswers.text: You can do this! Kneel at his side and put the arm nearest you out at a right angle to his body
I'll walk you through it. You need to sit him up against something like a wall.

dialogue2.text: Okay, I'm at his side. The nearest arm…out at a right angle. Right, I've done that. What next?

acceptedAnswers.text: Good. Now move his other hand out and under his head, like how you might sleep.

dialogue2.text:
Okay, I can do that. He's near a wall. I can move him towards it… 
… Alright , I did that. He's propped up against the wall.

acceptedAnswers.text: That's great. Stay with him. Can you see anyone else?
Well done! Can you tell me anything about the burglars?

dialogue2.text: Alright, I've done that!

acceptedAnswers.text: That's great! Now bend his furthest leg into a right angle and use it to pull him onto his side

dialogue2.text: I don't think so, no. I'm pretty sure there was no one else in here.

acceptedAnswers.text: You've done really well. Can you tell me anything about the burglars?

dialogue2.text: They were both male I think. They had black masks on, and black clothes. They didn't sound foreign.

acceptedAnswers.text: That's really useful! Did you say your head was hit?

dialogue2.text: Okay… his furthest leg… pull him onto his side… he's really heavy! I  think I've done it though. He's still breathing at least.

acceptedAnswers.text: Fantastic! One last step, tilt his head back and lift his chin, so his airway is clear!

dialogue2.text: Yeah, when they first came in, one of them hit me. With a gun I think. It really hurt!

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay Matt, do you feel dizzy? Sick? Where on your head were you hit?

dialogue2.text: Alright… I've done that.

acceptedAnswers.text: You've done really well Matt. I'm going to get some help sent over to you now, just stay put.
You're doing great Matt. Can you tell me anything about the burglars?

dialogue2.text: I feel okay, just sore. He hit the top of my head. I've got a headache. It isn't bleeding though, I checked.

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay Matt, you've been really helpful. I'm going to get some help out to the store for you now. Just stay put.
Okay Matt, and you can't feel any other injuries?

dialogue2.text: I don't think so, no. I got pretty lucky. I think the owner just made a noise. He isn't awake though. Should I do something?

acceptedAnswers.text: The best thing you can do right now is to stay with him. Is he still breathing?
The best thing you can do now is to go outside so that when help comes they know what to look for.

dialogue2.text: Yeah, I think so. I think he needs help though. What should I do?

acceptedAnswers.text: You've done really well Matt. I'm going to get some help sent over to you now, just stay put

dialogue2.text: Oh… okay … I'm heading outside. What should I do now? What about the owner?

acceptedAnswers.text: Don’t worry about him, I'm going to get some help sent over to you now. Just stay put

dialogue3.text: Welcome, Operator. Are you ready to begin?

acceptedAnswers.text: I'm ready!

dialogue3.text: INCOMING CALL ALERT
Hello?... Hi. Uhh… what?... No, hold on. I'm ringing them.

acceptedAnswers.text: This is 911, what's your emergency?
Hello? You're through to 911, can I help you?

dialogue3.text: Hi there. I, uh, need to order some pizza please

acceptedAnswers.text: You know it's a felony to prank call 911, right?
Did I understand you correct? You want to order pizza?

dialogue3.text: I do, but, uhh…I need a pizza delivered please.

acceptedAnswers.text: You understand that you've called 911, yes?

dialogue3.text: Yeah that's correct. I need it delivered please.

acceptedAnswers.text: Do you need help? Do you have a situation?

dialogue3.text: Yes that's right. I'd like 2 pizzas please, delivered, as soon as possible.

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay, and you can't speak openly with me? Because you aren't alone?
I'm going to need to you be clearer please, what's going on?

dialogue3.text: Yes that's correct. I'd like 2 pizzas please, delivered, as soon as possible

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay. You can't speak openly with, because you aren't alone? Is that right?
If you're in trouble, I'm going to need you to be clearer on what's going on.

dialogue3.text: Yes, that's correct.  Are there any deals on the moment?

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay, I'm going to spell out some options. Just say yes or no
Can you describe your emergency? Are you hurt or in danger?

dialogue3.text: Sorry, it must be my phone connection. I'd like to order 2 large pizzas, to be delivered as soon as possible.

acceptedAnswers.text: Alright, can you tell me anything about what's going on? Are you alone?
Can you describe your emergency to me? Are you hurt? In danger?

dialogue3.text: Okay, that'd be great, thank you

acceptedAnswers.text: Alright, you're with somebody, yes? And they're putting you in danger?
Has somebody broken into your home? And is holding you hostage?

dialogue3.text: No thank you. Could I get some extra toppings on the pizzas? Could you tell me what the options are?

acceptedAnswers.text: Alright, are you with somebody? And they're putting you in danger?
Are you being held against your will?

dialogue3.text: No, it's for me and one other please. 2 pizzas. What are the options for toppings please?

acceptedAnswers.text: If you can say yes or no, tell me, are you in danger?
Has someone broken into your home? Or is a family member putting you danger?

dialogue3.text: Yes that's all, thank you. How much will that be?

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay, can you stay on the line? What's your name?
Can you tell me who's putting you in danger?

dialogue3.text: Uhh, no thank you. How much will that be? I'll be paying on my husband's card if that's alright

acceptedAnswers.text: Your husband is the one putting you in danger? Have you been physically
Where is your husband now? Can you describe what's happened?

dialogue3.text: Yes, that's right. How long will delivery take?

acceptedAnswers.text: Can you tell me who's putting you in danger please?
If he's been out cold a while, I'm going to need you to put him in the recovery position

dialogue3.text: No, that's all thank you. The name is Jane Hills.

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay Jane. I'm going to get some help out to you now. Can you stay on the line?

dialogue3.text: Yes that's right. That's all thank you. How long will delivery take?

acceptedAnswers.text: I'll get some help out to you as soon as possible. Can you stay on the line?

dialogue3.text: No I don't think so. Could I get that to be delivered as soon as possible please?

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay, I'm going to get some help out to you now. Can you stay on the line?

dialogue3.text: No, that's everything. Thanks for your help.

acceptedAnswers.text: Alright Jane, help is coming.

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay Matt. I need you to go back inside the building and find the owner

dialogue5.text: I'm 24. I think the store owner is still inside. I think he got hurt. Someone hit my head too. It all feels like a blur.

acceptedAnswers.text: Alright Matt, are you able to find the owner?

dialogue5.text:
Okay. Hold on. I'll see if I can find him. 
… … … ...okay, I found him!

acceptedAnswers.text: Good. Is he breathing? I need you tell me if he's hurt
Can you see any injuries on him? Is he conscious?

dialogue5.text:
Uhh, I think so. I'll go inside. I can't believe this has happened. 
… … … ...okay, I found him!

acceptedAnswers.text: Can you see any injuries on him? Is he conscious?
That's great Matt. I need you check if he's breathing. Any injuries?

dialogue5.text: I think he's breathing, yeah. He isn't awake though. I can see some blood on his shoulder. Left Shoulder. I think that's where he got shot.

acceptedAnswers.text: Alright, well done. Is there a lot of blood? Can you see where it's coming from?
I'm going to need you put him into the recovery position. I'll talk you through it, don't worry

dialogue5.text: I'm going to need you put him into the recovery position. I'll talk you through it, don't worry.

acceptedAnswers.text: Alright, thank you. Is the wound bleeding a lot? We might need to dress it.
If he's been out cold a while, I'm going to need you to put him in the recovery position

dialogue5.text: There's a big red patch on his shirt, but I can't see much coming out of him now. Oh man, it looks like something from a film. What should I do?

acceptedAnswers.text: If the wound looks okay, I'm going to need you put him into the recovery position

dialogue5.text: Oh my god, okay. Man this is scary. Okay, what should I do?

acceptedAnswers.text: You can do this! Kneel at his side and put the arm nearest you out at a right angle to his body
I'll walk you through it. You need to sit him up against something like a wall.

dialogue5.text: Okay, I'm at his side. The nearest arm…out at a right angle. Right, I've done that. What next?

acceptedAnswers.text: Good. Now move his other hand out and under his head, like how you might sleep.

dialogue5.text:
Okay, I can do that. He's near a wall. I can move him towards it… 
… Alright , I did that. He's propped up against the wall.

acceptedAnswers.text: That's great. Stay with him. Can you see anyone else?
Well done! Can you tell me anything about the burglars?

dialogue5.text: Alright, I've done that!

acceptedAnswers.text: That's great! Now bend his furthest leg into a right angle and use it to pull him onto his side

dialogue5.text: I don't think so, no. I'm pretty sure there was no one else in here.

acceptedAnswers.text: You've done really well. Can you tell me anything about the burglars?

dialogue5.text: They were both male I think. They had black masks on, and black clothes. They didn't sound foreign.

acceptedAnswers.text: That's really useful! Did you say your head was hit?

dialogue5.text: Okay… his furthest leg… pull him onto his side… he's really heavy! I  think I've done it though. He's still breathing at least.

acceptedAnswers.text: Fantastic! One last step, tilt his head back and lift his chin, so his airway is clear!

dialogue5.text: Yeah, when they first came in, one of them hit me. With a gun I think. It really hurt!

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay Matt, do you feel dizzy? Sick? Where on your head were you hit?

dialogue5.text: Alright… I've done that.

acceptedAnswers.text: You've done really well Matt. I'm going to get some help sent over to you now, just stay put.
You're doing great Matt. Can you tell me anything about the burglars?

dialogue5.text: I feel okay, just sore. He hit the top of my head. I've got a headache. It isn't bleeding though, I checked.

acceptedAnswers.text: Okay Matt, you've been really helpful. I'm going to get some help out to the store for you now. Just stay put.
Okay Matt, and you can't feel any other injuries?

dialogue5.text: I don't think so, no. I got pretty lucky. I think the owner just made a noise. He isn't awake though. Should I do something?

acceptedAnswers.text: The best thing you can do right now is to stay with him. Is he still breathing?
The best thing you can do now is to go outside so that when help comes they know what to look for.

dialogue5.text: Yeah, I think so. I think he needs help though. What should I do?

acceptedAnswers.text: You've done really well Matt. I'm going to get some help sent over to you now, just stay put

dialogue5.text: Oh… okay …I'm heading outside. What should I do now? What about the owner?

acceptedAnswers.text: Don’t worry about him, I'm going to get some help sent over to you now. Just stay put
